User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the DocConnect application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity. This should be the Firebase Auth UID.

role.description: The role of the user within the application.

DoctorProfile.title: DoctorProfile
DoctorProfile.description: Represents the professional profile of a user with the 'doctor' role.

id.description: Unique identifier for the DoctorProfile, typically the same as the User UID.

specialization.description: The doctor's area of specialization (e.g., Cardiology, Pediatrics).

experienceYears.description: The number of years of experience the doctor has.

availability.description: Information about the doctor's availability (e.g., days of the week, time slots).

photoUrl.description: URL to the doctor's profile photo.

Appointment.title: Appointment
Appointment.description: Represents a scheduled appointment between a user and a doctor.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Appointment entity.

patientId.description: Reference to the User with role 'patient'.

doctorId.description: Reference to the User with role 'doctor'.

startTime.description: The date and time the appointment is scheduled to begin.

endTime.description: The date and time the appointment is scheduled to end.

status.description: The status of the appointment such as 'Scheduled', 'Completed', or 'Cancelled'.

ConsultationSummary.title: ConsultationSummary
ConsultationSummary.description: Represents the summary of a consultation generated after a video call.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ConsultationSummary entity.

summaryText.description: The text of the generated consultation summary.

createdTime.description: The time at which the consultation summary was created.

definition.description: Stores all user profiles, for both patients and doctors. The 'role' field distinguishes them. Path-based ownership ensures users can only access their own profile data.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user.

definition.description: Stores the professional profile for users with the 'doctor' role.

params.name: userId
params.description: The UID of the user this profile belongs to.

params.name: profileId
params.description: The unique identifier for the doctor profile.

definition.description: Top-level collection for all appointments. Security rules will grant access based on patientId or doctorId.

params.name: appointmentId
params.description: The unique identifier for the appointment.

definition.description: Stores consultation summaries for a given appointment.

params.name: appointmentId
params.description: The ID of the parent appointment.

params.name: summaryId
params.description: The unique ID for the summary.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support a role-based application (patients and doctors). A single `/users` collection is used for authentication and basic profile data, with a `role` field to differentiate. Doctor-specific professional data is stored in a subcollection `/users/{userId}/doctorProfile` to keep the main user document lean. Appointments are in a top-level collection for easier querying by both patients and doctors, with security rules ensuring that only involved parties can access the appointment details. This structure is scalable and secure.
